Customers - Numbers: Number of branches and business banking centres2
1. Includes Australian and New Zealand customers. The increase in customer numbers between 2021 and 2022 is primarily driven by the acquisition of Citi consumer business.

2. Data represents ‘points of presence’ or physical locations of branches and business banking centres in Australia and New Zealand, to avoid double-counting branches and business banking centres at the same address. 2019 number represents Group footprint.

Total complaints referred by customers to ombudsmen/external dispute resolution bodies

From ombudsmen/external dispute resolution bodies - Australia2,3
From ombudsmen/external dispute resolution bodies - New Zealand2

1. A substantiated complaint is a written statement by regulatory or similar official body addressed to the organisation that identifies breaches of customer privacy, or a complaint lodged with the organization that has been recognized as legitimate by the organization (as defined in GRI Sustainability Reporting Standards 418 Customer Privacy, relating to GRI disclosure 418-1).
2. These complaints are those received via the Australian Financial Complaints Authority (AFCA) in Australia and the Banking Ombudsmen Scheme in New Zealand.
3. From 2022, figures include customer complaints associated with Citi consumer business and from 2023, figures include Citi consumer business and ubank. 2022 figures have not been assured by EY.
Number of critical and high priority technology incidents - Australia

1. Critical priority incidents: significant impact or outages to customer facing service or payment channels. High priority incidents: functionality impact to customer facing service or impact/outage to internal systems.
Customer advocacy – Net Promoter Score results

1. Net Promoter® and NPS® are registered trademarks and Net Promoter Score and Net Promoter Systems are trademarks of Bain & Company, Inc., NICE Systems, Inc., and Fred Reichheld. Figures prior to 2022 have not been assured by EY.
2. Sourced from DBM Consumer Atlas (part of RFI Global), measured on 6 month rolling average. Consumer NPS excludes consumers with Personal income of $260k+ and/or investible assets $1m+.

3. Sourced from DBM Business Atlas (part of RFI Global), measured on 6 month rolling average. Business NPS is based on equal (25:25:25:25) combined weighting of NAB turnover segments: Micro (Up to $100k turnover), Small ($100k - $5m turnover), Medium ($5m - $50m turnover), Large ($50m+).

4. Sourced from DBM Consumer Atlas (part of RFI Global), measured on 6 month rolling average. Based on all consumers, 18+, in either High Net Worth definition or Mass Affluent definition and on equal (50:50) combined weighting of included segments. Mass Affluent includes consumers with Personal income of $260k+ and investible assets less than $2.5m and/or investible assets $1m<$2.5m, High Net Worth includes consumers with Investible assets of $2.5m+.

5. Source: 1) Camorra Retail Market Monitor 1 October 2022 – 30 September 2023; 2) Kantar Business Finance Monitor 1 October 2022 – 30 September 2023. The Consumer NPS score reflects the total Consumer market, and the Business NPS score reflects that of the total Business market.
